Member Enumeration Documentation

anonymous enum
Enumerator:
THRESHOLD_IA 
anonymous enum

Type of Stream The type of a stream is given by a ORed values. Bit 0: 0 -> encode 1 -> decode Bit 1: 0 -> normal 1 -> checkpoint

Member Function Documentation

bool Util::Stream_base::is_type ( ka_uint8_t  type  )  const

Return true iff the steam is of given type For instance is_type( DECODE | CHECKPOINT ) return true iff the stream is of kind 'checkpoint' with direction 'encode'.

virtual bool Util::Stream_base::overflow ( Mode  m,
size_t  add_len 
) [protected, virtual]

Function called when the array of mode 'm' is fill. The return value is 'true' is a the stream process of defining a format could be continued, and 'false' is this process should be stop.

Parameters:
m the mode of insertion into the stream that make overflow
add_len the size requested at insertion
void Util::Stream_base::set_type ( ka_uint8_t  type  )  throw (InvalidArgumentError) [protected]

Set the type of the stream Set the type of the stream using predefined Type value. OR of value is also possible, e.g. ENCODE | CHECKPOINT means that the type of the stream is for encoding into a checkpoint kind of stream.

Parameters:
type a ORed value of type
